name: Victoria Hoi An Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At $125/night, the Victoria Hoi An was the splurge hotel on our Vietnam trip, and it lived up to our expectations. We spent four nights in a superior room on the second floor of the main hotel building. The room was large, with a high vaulted ceiling and a large balcony with a great view of the gardens and of the ocean over the roofs of the beach front bungalows. There was also plenty of storage space for clothes, something of a rarity among Vietnamese hotels. The bathroom was large and the bathtub huge. Special touches included small pots of shampoo, conditioner and body lotions that were renewed daily, and a nightly “bed time story” – a local legend printed on a scroll that was left with chocolates on our pillow each evening.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has beautiful, well maintained grounds and a great pool, although it tends to get crowded in the afternoons. The spa has a free section where there is a nice Jacuzzi and a sauna. There is also an expansive book exchange upstairs next to one of the bars. That bar was closed during our stay, but the pool tables were available for use. Next to the bar is the internet room with six computers.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing after a hard day of visiting

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, among the best we had during our trip. We didn’t eat other meals at the hotel – it is hard to justify hotel meals that are double the price (or more) of the local restaurants. There are a variety of low cost restaurants and convenience stores on the main road to Hoi An, about a five minute walk from the hotel. The hotel also has a tour desk but, again, it was simply too expensive – a tour of Marble Mountain that we booked in town for $15 was listed at $25/person at the hotel.
reviews.title: Disappointing for the price, quite tired place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Victoria and recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing stay or looking for a base for visiting the tailors of Hoi An.
reviews.title: I'd go back....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hoi An is a very special magic place with a heady ambiance. The Victoria, at bicycle distance (but they also have a shuttle bus) is right on the beach. The rooms are small houses replicating the Hoi An style. The service is excellent, food good (we only had breakfast don't like to sleep in restaurants so I don't eat in hotels.) Typical Victoria style: original, almsost luxurious, comfortable.
reviews.title: Thoroughly disappointed

likes.disliked: — standards of staff service, quality of food and lack of food choices

reviews.text: We stayed two nights in a Deluxe Seaview Room with a Japanese theme. It was pure bliss. We spent may hours on the balcony, it was total relaxation, a welcome break from the many hours of walking we had done.
reviews.title: Pure Relaxation

reviews.text: The rooms are enormous and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was wonderful with a luxurious spa bath (complete with candles) and lovely outdoor shower.
reviews.title: Pure luxury and relaxation
Paradise! Fabulous Beach, Wonderful beach bungalow.
reviews.text: It's only a short trip into town by shuttle and I would definitely stay there again if I visit Hoi An.

This resort was absolutely beautiful. We booked deluxe beach front through Vietnamstay.com. At first there was only a twin available but when we arrived the hotel had put us in a king size brand new room. Huge room with lounge, huge flatscreen TV, dressing room, separate toilet, huge bathroom with spa, outdoor courtyard with outdoor shower!! Breakfast included / excellent. Shuttle in to hoi an very efficient and friendly. We had an amazing 5 night stay (paid for 4) walking on the beach, relaxing by the pool and having clothes and shoes made in Hoi An. Can't wait to go back one day for the excellent service and location, location, location.
reviews.title: What a great place

reviews.text: We stayed at this wonderful resort for 3 nights after staying in the town of Hoian.
reviews.title: Super Resort in Great Location

likes.disliked: — Rooms slightly tired and in need of some refurbishment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is a serene spot on the beach that provides a bit of fresh air for travelers visiting the dusty corners of Vietnamese cities. Rooms are clean and well equipped and we found the food quite good. We were there on Christmas eve and had to endure a ridiculously priced "compulsory dinner" that travelers should be careful to avoid if traveling on that day. The hotel provides a bus shuttle to the town, a wonderful place to wander and shop.
reviews.title: Nice place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I strongly disagree with the positive reviews below. Certainly the Victoria is not a terrible hotel-- my room (the standard room) was adequate although quite tired. However, as a luxury property, this place was sub-par. It operates as if it is the only game in town (which it may have been) but judging from the construction going on, it may be facing more competition.
reviews.title: Victoria: stay elsewhere!!!
HoiAn a fun city to visit
reviews.text: As a point of comparison, I had just come from the Pilgrimage Village in Hue where for $130/night I stayed in an enormous personal villa with our own small pool and extremely helpful staff. At the Victoria, for $160/night, I was in a small room facing the road with staff that could not be bothered to help. The staff actually tried to cheat us on the posted exchange rate! And, upon check out, there were mysterious mini-bar charges that we had to dispute.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle bus was also ridiculous...they operate it extremely infrequently in the morning (2x) as a thinly-disguised ploy to make you pay $2 per person to take the shuttle outside the scheduled times. In the evening, they operate only one shuttle to return from town and we made sure to show up early since the bus filled up quickly. Each night, the driver appeared befuddled at what to do with the extra people-- run another bus!
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay even in the rain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are just looking for a place to stay, then this place is certainly adequate. However, if you are looking for a luxurious resort getaway in Hoi An, look elsewhere!
reviews.title: Great place, despite rain!!

likes.liked: — Very comfortable with great view of beach
likes.disliked: — To far to walk to main building when raining

reviews.text: This hotel is right on the beach, and most of rooms are either facing the beach or right on the beach. We got a junior suite, which is on the beach and is very big, it even has outdoor shower, which is great when its as hot as in april. Breakfast is very good, as well as the swimming pool. But the general facilities (lobby, grounds,service...) are not up to 5 star standards (it is officially a 4star). We paid 215usd for the junior suite inc bfast, which is a "normal" rate I would say, although we didnt get all the perks like free minibar, which they usually give to junior suite bookings via their internet website (more expensive).
reviews.title: Great rooms, but still a 4star hotel, not 5

reviews.text: Our stay at Victoria Hoi An Beach Resort could not have been more perfect! The service was wonderful. On the way to breakfast on the first morning of our stay, the hotel staff greeted us by name. They made us feel that we were the most important guests at the hotel. (This was standard every morning of our 10 day stay.) The breakfast was great! The variety and quality of the breakfast foods, fruits, homemade breads could not have been better.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was so pretty. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom is large, and the spa-inspired toiletries were very nice.
reviews.title: Our loveliest hotel room ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the beach and the pool. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Not only was their service attentive, but they were happy to help with any requests and answer questions we had about Hoi An Town.
reviews.title: Blissfully relaxing :)

reviews.text: We loved everything about the resort. It was a perfect vacation/trip!!
reviews.title: very enjoyable and relaxed few days.

aka: Victoria Hoi An Beach Hotel Hoi An
description: Discover Hoi An, splendor of the past Annam, a most charming town listed as a World Heritage site by UNESCO. Explore the vestiges of a glorious Cham past. Located along the unique private beach of white sand, Victoria Hoi An Beach Resort & Spa replicates a traditional fishing village with small streets, water ponds and village houses with clay-tiled roofs, providing a warm and restful environment.
